website_summaries.verdict: A countertop option for those that prefer to blend in an easy-pour jar.
pros: 2 speeds and a pulse setting to blend or whip up a delicious smoothie
Preset mode for crushing ice, a convenient setting for making drinks for guests
Comes with a travel smoothie cup
cons: Buttons are sensitive, and plastic casing is not as high-end as other blender models

customer_reviews.title: Smooth(ie) Operator
customer_reviews.text: Makes great smoothies. I use Trader Joe's frozen fruit, yogurt etc and it does a great job. Braun is a Quality manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Redwagen

customer_reviews.title: Such perfect pieces, BUT.....
customer_reviews.text: If your looking to do powder protein shakes, you must use the PITCHER, not the individual cup. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Transposed city girl making her way in the country...with no club!

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to use the correct blade in jug vs. mug!
customer_reviews.text: Great blender! We tried much more expensive brands and this one beats them all. Acceptable noise level where others were like jet engines. One caveat: be sure to notice that the two blades are NOT interchangeable. The gray blade is for the smoothie cup and the black blade is for the jug. I used the smoothie blade on the jug and it was stuck on so tight I could not remove the assembly. Operator error so unfortunately Braun customer service couldn't do a free replacement. We ended up just buying a whole new unit at a little more than what it would have cost to buy replacement parts (jug, smoothie blade, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Jrsygrl

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Basic
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different brands over the years and currently regularly use a Ninja that can also blend either a full pitcher or a to-go cup. There are benefits to this Braun - specifically the cup, that doesn't leak, verses the Ninja, that makes no attempt to seal - and the power is excellent. If I didn't already love the Ninja, I would seriously consider this one for two reasons: 1) it does almost exactly what the Ninja does, and 2) it's like half the price.
customer_reviews.author: AshertopiA

customer_reviews.title: Great for Smoothies!
customer_reviews.text: The Braun JB7001 PureMix Countertop Blender with Smoothie2Go is a great little machine. Simple to use, easy to clean. The LED panel puts the controls at the touch of a button. The JB7001 stirs, liquifies, and crushes quickly and efficiently, and makes the best smoothies ever. It comes with a measuring cap that makes mixing ingredients as you go a snap. The PureMix will be especially appreciated if you have a smaller kitchen because it is quite compact and doesn't take up as much counter space as a regular blender.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kear

customer_reviews.title: Nice blender with plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good sized blender. It has good power for making my smoothies and malts, and the two different sized containers are handy. Although it has half the horsepower as my big Vitamix, it actually has similar performance. You do have to make sure the container is positioned correctly or it won't turn on. The buttons are sealed, which makes cleaning easier. All in all a good product, as I would expect from Braun.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Worst blender ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst blender ever. For whatever reason, the piece that secures the blade in the cup tightens as you blend it, leaving it impossible to take off. 3 times now I have not been able to drink the smoothie I’ve made because I can’t get the blade out. And if I use the pitcher, it doesn’t blend well at all and makes a mess when you pour from it.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: This is the best ever for blending protein shakes!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only blender I have found that will blend my protein powders with out leaving powder on the mug. I don’t know about the ones that cost hundreds of dollars. But I’m convinced you will not find a better blender under $100.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Braun JB7001 PureMix Countertop Blender with Smoothie2Go, Black
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this blender. It does a great job at blending, doesn't leave chunks and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Kilpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great for smoothies
customer_reviews.text: Works for me! Basically use Braun JB7001 for smoothies. Plus for me smoothie cup to go. Honestly basic blender not as loud which is a plus and price affordable.
